180.writer: Umarji Anuradha, Jayendra, Aarthi Sriram, & Suba

AFTER THE THIN MAN.title: After the Thin Man
AFTER THE THIN MAN.fun_fact: The Tower was funded by a gift bequeathed by Lillie Hitchcock Coit, a socialite who reportedly liked to chase fires. Though the tower resembles a firehose nozzle, it was not designed this way.

ALL ABOUT EVE.title: All About Eve
ALL ABOUT EVE.fun_fact: Called the Shubert Theatre in the film.

AROUND THE FIRE.title: Around the Fire

BEDAZZLED.title: Bedazzled
BEDAZZLED.fun_fact: Installed in 1975, the Vaillancourt Fountain is officially titled, "Québec Libre!". The night before the sculpture's inauguration, artist Armand Vaillancourt inscribed "Québec libre!" in red letters on the sculpture. The next day when he noticed that the note had been erased, Vaillancourt jumped on the statue to reinscribe his message.
locations: Washington Square Park (Filbert, between Stockton and Powell)

BICENTENNIAL MAN.title: Bicentennial Man
BICENTENNIAL MAN.fun_fact: The dome of SF's City Hall is almost a foot taller than that of the US Capitol Building. In 1954, Joe DiMaggio and Marilyn Monroe married at the Beaux Arts-style building.
locations: Postcard Row, Alamo Square, Hayes Valley
Grace Cathedral Episcopal Church (1100 California Street)

COPYCAT.title: Copycat
COPYCAT.fun_fact: The 2nd highest point in SF after Mt. Davidson, Twin Peaks sit at the geographic center of SF. The native Ohlone people called the area "called the area “Los Pechos de la Chola” or "Breasts of the Indian Maiden," but in the 19th Century when America took over the area, it was renamed "Twin Peaks".

FAMILY PLOT.title: Family Plot
